intro: Hieracium noeanum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters, with basal leaves that are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium noeanum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
